Repository Name Unauthorized: Birmingham Public Library, Archives and Manuscripts Department
Notes: The Birmingham Public Library established its Department of Archives and Manuscripts to collect source material related to the history of Birmingham, Jefferson County, and north central Alabama.  The department is a component of the Edward Magruder Tutwiler collection, which also holds maps, rare books, and materials to support genealogical research.  Archives and manuscripts holdings total approximately 12,000 cubic feet and include sound recordings, still pictures, motion pictures, and microforms.  Civil rights; local government; urban and real estate development; architecture; education; the iron, steel and coal industries; plantation life; the Civil War; religion; women; and the postal history of the Confederate States and Alabama are among the subjects covered.  Significant holdings include Birmingham mayoral office records beginning in 1913; records of the Episcopal Diocese of Alabama from 1840; WBRC and WVTM news film collections from 1961; the Scruggs Postal History Collection, 1460--1966; and the Faunsdale Plantation records, 1842-1970.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
